results.title: The Paradine Case
results.creator_credit: Selznick Pictures, David O. Selznick and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: Gregory Peck plays Anthony Keane, a brilliant young lawyer, at the height of his professional career, charged with the defence of a married woman accused of murdering her blind husband. Keane falls madly in love with his client Mrs. Paradine played by Alida Vali, who convinces him of her innocence. The tension builds from their first meeting and finally erupts in an emotionally charged courtroom. Rated: PG
results.creator_credit_for_label: Selznick Pictures, David O. Selznick and Alfred Hitchcock

results.title: The Paper kite
results.creator_credit: National Film Board of Norway, Caprino Films, UNICEF and Ivo Caprino
results.brief_description: Depicts the dream of a Norwegian boy about the magic of UNICEF aid, in which puppets tell an entertaining and fanciful story of how UNICEF-aided projects bring hope and well-being to children all over the world.

results.title: The Paper
results.creator_credit: Imagine Entertainment (US), Brian Grazer, Frederick Zollo and Ron Howard
results.brief_description: Today, Henry Hackett (Michael Keaton), Metro editor of a New York tabloid has to make big decisions. His heavily pregnant wife (Marisa Tomei) is facing urgent deadlines of her own. Henry’s boss, the managing editor (Glenn Close) is also reaching a crisis in her life and her senior (Robert Duvall) has just discovered he is an extremely sick man. To top it all, the paper is in pursuit of a hot story that could expose a major scandal and free two innocent boys charged with murder if they can beat the deadline. With the clock ticking, the tension mounts and somewhere amidst the chaos are moments that could change these people’s lives forever. Directed by Ron Howard and also starring Randy Quaid, this film is an inside look at the ruthless and sometimes savage newspaper business.

results.title: The Pantomime dame
results.brief_description: Investigates the reasons for the Dame’s enduring hold on the audience’s imagination. It examines her function as an outrageous and aggressive parody of female behaviour and the changes in portrayal corresponding with changing social attitudes to women and sexuality. Above all the program attempts to discover why we laugh at her. Cast includes Arthur Askey, George Lacy, Duggie Byng, Paul Laidlaw, Terry Scott, Ian Evans, Jack Tripp, Victoria Wood and John Morley.

results.title: The Panda's boutique
results.creator_credit: Shanghai Meishu, British Broadcasting Corporation, Louis Elman, Shen Zuwei and Zhou Keqin
results.brief_description: A delightful Chinese animation about a family of pandas who run a boutique. Complete chaos is caused, one morning, when customers in all different shapes and sizes arrive and request some oddly shaped items.

results.title: The Panda
results.creator_credit: Shanghai Scientific and Educational Film Studio
results.brief_description: The Panda is a survivor from ancient times and now is only found in the North of China. They were almost extinct, but the care by forest rangers and the people of China has assured their survival.
results.description: The Panda is a survivor from ancient times and now is only found in the North of China. They were almost extinct, but the care by forest rangers and the people of China has assured their survival.

results.title: The Panda
results.brief_description: The giant panda is undoubtedly a beautiful and endearing animal. Only known in the west for a hundred years or so, and extremely rare, it has nevertheless become the best known of threatened species, and an immediately recognised symbol for conservation throughout the world. Through newsreel, archival and contemporary film, this program explores the past, present and likely future of the giant panda.

results.title: The Panama Canal
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the Panama Canal, explaining how it operates and discussing its significance to world transportation. Includes scenes of a trip through the Canal and views of life in surrounding cities.

results.title: The Pale horseman
results.creator_credit: United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration and Irving Jacoby
results.brief_description: Depicts health problems that follow in the wake of war, and explains how hunger and exposure have caused the spread of tuberculosis, cholera and malaria. Shows what Army doctors and UNRRA scientists have done in liberated countries to prevent the spread of epidemics.

results.title: The Pajama game
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, George Abbott and Stanley Donen
results.brief_description: A musical comedy about a pajama factory worker and her co-workers fight to get a 7.1/2 cents pay raise that is being fought by their employers. Cast includes Doris Day, John Raitt, Carol Haney and Eddie Foy Jr, with music and lyrics by Richard Adler and Jerry Ross, and choreography by Bob Fosse. Based upon the book “7.1/2 cents” by Richard Bissell and the play “The Pajama game” by George Abbott and Richard Bissell. Screenplay by George Abbott and Richard Bissell.
